---
title: "ICE7"
date: "OCtober 21, 2024"
date-modified: "last-modified"
execute: 
  eval: true
  echo: true
  freeze: true
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(spdep, sp, tmap, sf, ClustGeo, cluster, factoextra, NbClust, tidyverse, GGally)
```
:::


import from rds

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
shan_sf <- read_rds("data/rds/shan_sf.rds")
shan_ict <- read_rds("data/rds/shan_ict.rds")
shan_sf_cluster <- read_rds("data/rds/shan_sf_cluster.rds")
```
:::



Conventional Hierarchical Clustering


Hierachical clustering

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
proxmat <- dist(shan_ict, method = 'euclidean')
hclust_ward <- hclust(proxmat, method = 'ward.D')
groups <- as.factor(cutree(hclust_ward, k=6))
```
:::


Append to the geospatial data

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
shan_sf_cluster <- cbind(shan_sf, 
                         as.matrix(groups)) %>%
  rename(`CLUSTER`=`as.matrix.groups.`) %>%
  select(-c(3:4, 7:9)) %>%
  rename(TS = TS.x)
```
:::



The dendrogram

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(hclust_ward, cex = 0.6)
rect.hclust(hclust_ward, k = 6, border = 2:5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=1152}
:::
:::



Cluster map

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
qtm(shan_sf_cluster, "CLUSTER")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#qtm useful for categorical data
```
:::


Spatially Constrained Clustering: SKATER method


Computing nearest neighbours

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
shan.nb <- poly2nb(shan_sf)
summary(shan.nb)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Neighbour list object:
Number of regions: 55 
Number of nonzero links: 264 
Percentage nonzero weights: 8.727273 
Average number of links: 4.8 
Link number distribution:

 2  3  4  5  6  7  8  9 
 5  9  7 21  4  3  5  1 
5 least connected regions:
3 5 7 9 47 with 2 links
1 most connected region:
8 with 9 links
```


:::
:::


------------------------------------------------------------------------

Visualising the neighbours

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(shan_sf), 
     border=grey(.5))
pts <- st_coordinates(st_centroid(shan_sf))
plot(shan.nb, 
     pts, 
     col="blue", 
     add=TRUE)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: st_centroid assumes attributes are constant over geometries
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=1152}
:::
:::


------------------------------------------------------------------------

Computing minimum spanning tree

Calculating edge costs

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lcosts <- nbcosts(shan.nb, shan_ict)
```
:::



Incorporating these costs into a weights object

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
shan.w <- nb2listw(shan.nb, 
                   lcosts, 
                   style="B")
summary(shan.w)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Characteristics of weights list object:
Neighbour list object:
Number of regions: 55 
Number of nonzero links: 264 
Percentage nonzero weights: 8.727273 
Average number of links: 4.8 
Link number distribution:

 2  3  4  5  6  7  8  9 
 5  9  7 21  4  3  5  1 
5 least connected regions:
3 5 7 9 47 with 2 links
1 most connected region:
8 with 9 links

Weights style: B 
Weights constants summary:
   n   nn       S0       S1        S2
B 55 3025 76267.65 58260785 522016004
```


:::
:::

style = "B" > binary calc , impt, nochangethis

Computing MST

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
shan.mst <- mstree(shan.w)
```
:::



Visualising MST

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(shan_sf), 
     border=gray(.5))
plot.mst(shan.mst, 
         pts, 
         col="blue", 
         cex.lab=0.7, 
         cex.circles=0.005, 
         add=TRUE)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Computing spatially constrained clusters using SKATER method



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
skater.clust6 <- skater(edges = shan.mst[,1:2], 
                 data = shan_ict, 
                 method = "euclidean", 
                 ncuts = 5)
```
:::


Skater tree

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in segments(coords[id1, 1], coords[id1, 2], coords[id2, 1], coords[id2,
: "add" is not a graphical parameter
Warning in segments(coords[id1, 1], coords[id1, 2], coords[id2, 1], coords[id2,
: "add" is not a graphical parameter
Warning in segments(coords[id1, 1], coords[id1, 2], coords[id2, 1], coords[id2,
: "add" is not a graphical parameter
Warning in segments(coords[id1, 1], coords[id1, 2], coords[id2, 1], coords[id2,
: "add" is not a graphical parameter
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=1152}
:::
:::


Plot skater tree

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(st_geometry(shan_sf), 
     border=gray(.5))
plot(skater.clust6, 
     pts, 
     cex.lab=.7,
     groups.colors=c("red","green","blue", "brown", "pink"),
     cex.circles=0.005, 
     add=TRUE)
```
:::


Visualising the clusters in choropleth map



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
groups_mat <- as.matrix(skater.clust6$groups)
shan_sf_spatialcluster <- cbind(shan_sf_cluster, as.factor(groups_mat)) %>%
  rename(`skater_CLUSTER`=`as.factor.groups_mat.`)
qtm(shan_sf_spatialcluster, "skater_CLUSTER")
```
:::


------------------------------------------------------------------------

Plotting the cluster maps



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hclust.map <- qtm(shan_sf_cluster,
                  "CLUSTER") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c(0.8, 0.6))

shclust.map <- qtm(shan_sf_spatialcluster,
                   "skater_CLUSTER") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c(0.7, 0.6))

tmap_arrange(hclust.map, shclust.map,
             asp=NA, ncol=2)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=1152}
:::
:::



ClustGeo Spatially Constrained Clustering


Computing spatial distance matrix

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dist <- st_distance(shan_sf, shan_sf)
distmat <- as.dist(dist)
```
:::


Cluster graphs 

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cr <- choicealpha(proxmat, distmat, 
                  range.alpha = seq(0, 1, 0.1), 
                  K=6, graph = TRUE)
```
:::


Saving clustGeo output 



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
clustG <- hclustgeo(proxmat, distmat, alpha = 0.2) #<- alpha from graphs above
groups <- as.factor(cutree(clustG, k=6))
shan_sf_clustGeo <- cbind(shan_sf, 
                          as.matrix(groups)) %>%
  rename(`clustGeo` = `as.matrix.groups.`)
```
:::


---

Visualising the clustGeo map

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
qtm(shan_sf_clustGeo, "clustGeo")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



------------------------------------------------------------------------

Comparing cluster maps

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hclust.map <- qtm(shan_sf_cluster,
                  "CLUSTER") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c(0.8, 0.6))

shclust.map <- qtm(shan_sf_spatialcluster,
                   "skater_CLUSTER") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c(0.7, 0.6))

clustGeo.map <- qtm(shan_sf_clustGeo,
                   "clustGeo") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(legend.position = c(0.7, 0.6))

tmap_arrange(hclust.map, shclust.map, 
             clustGeo.map,
             asp=NA, ncol=3)
```
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=1536}
:::
:::


Characterising the clusters


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice7_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-29-1.png){width=1920}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggparcoord(data = shan_sf_clustGeo, 
           columns = c(17:21), 
           scale = "globalminmax",
           alphaLines = 0.2,
           boxplot = TRUE, 
           title = "Multiple Parallel Coordinates Plots of ICT Variables by Cluster") +
  facet_grid(~ clustGeo) + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30))
```
:::
